articles.headline: In Hospice Care, Longer Lives Mean Money Lost
articles.snippet: With patients living longer, the government is making hospices repay hundreds of millions of dollars to Medicare.
articles.abstract: With patients living longer, the government is making hospices repay hundreds of millions of dollars to Medicare.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAMDEN, Ala. — Hundreds of hospice providers across the country are facing the catastrophic financial consequence of what would otherwise seem a positive development: their patients are living longer than expected.

articles.headline: Citigroup Sells Abu Dhabi Fund $7.5 Billion Stake
articles.snippet: The investment underscores Citigroup’s depleted capital position, and also highlights the growing petrodollar wealth of Mideast countries.
articles.abstract: The investment underscores Citigroup’s depleted capital position, and also highlights the growing petrodollar wealth of Mideast countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: Citigroup announced last night that it was selling a $7.5 billion stake to a Middle Eastern sovereign fund in the latest bid to shore up its balance sheet.
articles.byline: By Eric Dash and Andrew Ross Sorkin

articles.headline: Stocks Down 10% From Recent High
articles.snippet: Concerns that problems in the credit market could push the economy into a recession drove investors to the safety of Treasuries and led to a sell-off of stocks on Monday.
articles.abstract: Concerns that problems in the credit market could push the economy into a recession drove investors to the safety of Treasuries and led to a sell-off of stocks on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: Concerns that problems in the credit market could push the economy into a recession drove investors to the safety of Treasuries yesterday and led to a sell-off of stocks.

articles.headline: China Deal Gives Lift to Revival of Fission
articles.snippet: Areva, the French nuclear power giant, signed the largest deal in the industry’s history Monday, with China’s leading nuclear power company.
articles.abstract: Areva, the French nuclear power giant, signed the largest deal in the industry’s history Monday, with China’s leading nuclear power company.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Nov. 26 — Areva, the French nuclear power giant, signed the largest deal in the industry’s history Monday, with China’s leading nuclear power company.

articles.headline: A Banker in Germany Says Trouble Is Not Over
articles.snippet: Nearly five months after the mortgage mess spilled into Europe, the head of Commerzbank said the full extent of the damage was still unclear.
articles.abstract: Nearly five months after the mortgage mess spilled into Europe, the head of Commerzbank said the full extent of the damage was still unclear.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT, Nov. 26 — Klaus-Peter Müller spent the better part of a decade working in the New York branch of Commerzbank, the German bank he now heads as chief executive. His daughter was born in Manhattan, and he has kept close ties to the United States.

articles.headline: Back in Pakistan, Sharif Condemns Musharraf
articles.snippet: Nawaz Sharif, the religiously conservative former prime minister, demanded an end to emergency rule.
articles.abstract: Nawaz Sharif, the religiously conservative former prime minister, demanded an end to emergency rule.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 26 — As prime minister in the 1990s, Nawaz Sharif was a religiously conservative, nationalist leader who allowed the Taliban to flourish in Afghanistan and detonated a nuclear weapon despite an American plea not to.

articles.headline: The U.S.S.R. Is Back (on Clothing Racks)
articles.snippet: Young and trendy Muscovites are in the throes of nostalgia for the staples of Soviet childhoods.
articles.abstract: Young and trendy Muscovites are in the throes of nostalgia for the staples of Soviet childhoods.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Nov. 26 — Empowered by an oil boom that pushed the country’s trade surplus past $94 billion this year, Russia has been flexing its muscles abroad. At home, meanwhile, young and trendy Muscovites are in the throes of nostalgia for the staples of Soviet childhoods, relics of a time when the U.S.S.R. was at the height of superpower status.

articles.headline: Round 2 for Biotech Beets
articles.snippet: Sensing that concerns over genetically engineered foods are subsiding, beet producers have cleared their growers to start planting biotech beets next spring.
articles.abstract: Sensing that concerns over genetically engineered foods are subsiding, beet producers have cleared their growers to start planting biotech beets next spring.
articles.lead_paragraph: Each growing season, like many other sugar beet farmers bedeviled by weeds, Robert Green repeatedly and painstakingly applies herbicides in a process he compares to treating cancer with chemotherapy.
